_exec_summary.SummaryText: OUR FACILITY HAS TAKEN MEASURES TO HELP REDUCE THE RISK OF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE. THIS COMPANY IS A FULL SERVICE FARM SUPPLY COMPANY WITH THE GREATEST RISK OF RELEASE COMING FROM OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE TANKS. WE ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, OR, OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACTS OF THE RELEASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT. tHIS LOCATION HAS 2 BULK TANKS AND 35 NURSE TANKS. THIS FACILITY HAS THE CAPACITY TO STORE 363,000 POUNDS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. THE STORAGE TANKS ARE LOCATED 1 MILE WEST OF LAMONI ON THE NORTH SIDE OF MAIN STREET. THE VALVES ARE LOCATED ON THE EAST END OF THE TANKS. THE NURSE TANK FILL STATION IS LOCATED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE TANKS. THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD BE THE RELEASE IN THE AMOUNT OF131,000 POUNDS. THE RELEASE WOULD BE 13,100 POUNDS PER MINUTE FOR 10 MINUTES. ASSUMING A 1.5 M/SEC. WIND SPEED, THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT WOULD BE 4.4 MI. AFFECTING 2319 PEOPLE. THE ALTERNATE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD BE A TRANSFER HOSE FAILURE. THE QUANTITY RELEASED WOULD BE 2,800POUNDS AT A RATE OF280 POUNDS PER MINUTE FOR 10 MINUTES ASSUMING A 3M PER SECOND WIND SPEED AFFECTING 15 PEOPLE. WE HAVE AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM IN EFFECT. THE FACILITY HAS BEEN REVIEWED FOR GENERAL COMPLIANCE WITH PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. (ANSI), 29 CFR 1910.111,"STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA". THE OSHA STANDARD IS REFERENCED IN THE REGISTRATION FORM SECTION 8.3b. ADDITIONAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION MEASURES WE UTILIZE RANGE FROM EMPLOYEE TRAINING TO EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE. WE HAVE EXCESS FLOW VALVES, BACK CHECK VALVES, AND PRESSURE RELIEF VALVES ON OUR AMMONIA SYSTEM. WE ALSO HAVE GAUGES TO TELL US WHEN THESE TANKS ARE FULL TO PREVE

NT THE OVER FILLING OF THESE TANKS WHICH IN TURN WOULD CREATE AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE. SAFETY IS AN ONGOING PROCESS. WE INSPECT OUR PLANT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND WE REVIEW OUR SAFETY POLICIES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. WE HAVE CONCRETE POLES TO PROTECT STORAGE TANKS FROM VEHICULAR DAMAGE. WE HAVE NOT HAD AN ACCIDENT WITHIN THE LAST 5 YEARS. OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM CONSISTS OF A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29 CFR 1910.38. WE ALSO FOLLOW THE IOWA FERTILIZER RULE STNADARDS AND PROVIDE STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIESWITH THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT TO KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA). WE WILL NOTIFY THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES AS WELL AS THE LEPC IF A RELEASE OCCURS. THE NUMBERS TO CALL ARE 911 AND (641)446-7307 RESPECTIVELY. OUR ROLE AS THE COMPANY WILL BE TO SECURE THE AREA UNTIL LOCAL AUTHORITIES ARRIVE AND ASSIST THEM IN ANY WAY POSSIBLE. THIS IS OUR PLAN IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR.
